meanings.definition: Possess: to have as belonging to one; own
meanings.sent3: He posses the ability to make people smile.
meanings.sent4: The artist posses a unique talent for capturing emotions.
meanings.sent5: The old man posses a vast collection of antique coins.

meanings.definition: Possible: capable of happening or being true
meanings.sent1: It is poss to finish the puzzle in one hour.
meanings.sent2: The plan is poss if we work together.
meanings.sent3: The idea of flying without wings seems quite poss.
meanings.sent4: Winning the lottery is a poss dream for many.
meanings.sent5: The experiment's success is still a poss outcome.

meanings.definition: Possibility: a chance that something may happen or be true
meanings.sent1: There is a poss of rain later today.
meanings.sent2: The team discussed the different possibilities for the project.
meanings.sent3: The sudden appearance of a unicorn is a fun poss.
meanings.sent4: In the world of magic, anything is a poss.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the unknown brings endless possibilities to light.
